net.dv8tion.jda.bot.sharding

Class DefaultShardManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dv8tion.jda.bot.sharding.DefaultShardManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ShardManager

    public class DefaultShardManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements ShardManager
    JDA's default ShardManager implementation. To create new instances use the DefaultShardManagerBuilder.
    Since:
    3.4
    Author:
    Aljoscha Grebe

    • Field Summary

      Whether or not JDA should try to reconnect if a connection-error is encountered.

      The MDC context provider new JDA instances should use on startup.

      The core pool size for the global JDA ScheduledExecutorService which is used in various locations throughout JDA.

    • Field Detail

      • LOG

        public static final org.slf4j.Logger LOG

      • DEFAULT_THREAD_FACTORY

        public static final java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory DEFAULT_THREAD_FACTORY

      • controller

        protected final SessionController controller
        The SessionController for this manager.

      • autoReconnect

        protected final boolean autoReconnect
        Whether or not JDA should try to reconnect if a connection-error is encountered.
        This will use an incremental reconnect (timeouts are increased each time an attempt fails).

      • corePoolSize

        protected final int corePoolSize
        The core pool size for the global JDA ScheduledExecutorService which is used in various locations throughout JDA.

      • enableBulkDeleteSplitting

        protected final boolean enableBulkDeleteSplitting
        If enabled, JDA will separate the bulk delete event into individual delete events, but this isn't as efficient as handling a single event would be.

      • enableVoice

        protected final boolean enableVoice
        Whether or not Voice functionality is enabled.

      • eventManager

        protected final IEventManager eventManager
        The IEventManager used by the ShardManager.

      • listeners

        protected final java.util.List<java.lang.Object> listeners
        The event listeners for new JDA instances.

      • maxReconnectDelay

        protected final int maxReconnectDelay
        The maximum amount of time that JDA will back off to wait when attempting to reconnect the MainWebsocket.

      • executor

        protected final java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService executor
        The executor that is used by the ShardManager internally to create new JDA instances.

      • queue

        protected final java.util.Queue<java.lang.Integer> queue
        The queue of shards waiting for creation.

      • shards

        protected ShardCacheViewImpl shards
        The ShardCacheView that holds all shards.

      • shardsTotal

        protected int shardsTotal
        The total number of shards.

        DO NOT CHANGE THIS WHILE SOME SHARD ARE STILL RUNNING !

      • httpClientBuilder

        protected final okhttp3.OkHttpClient.Builder httpClientBuilder
        The OkHttpClient.Builder that will be used by JDA's requester.

      • wsFactory

        protected final com.neovisionaries.ws.client.WebSocketFactory wsFactory
        The WebSocketFactory that will be used by JDA's websocket client.

      • retryOnTimeout

        protected final boolean retryOnTimeout
        Whether the Requester should retry when a SocketTimeoutException occurs.

      • useShutdownNow

        protected final boolean useShutdownNow
        Whether this ShardManager should use JDA#shutdownNow() instead of JDA#shutdown() to shutdown it's shards.

      • shutdown

        protected final java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean shutdown
        This can be used to check if the ShardManager is shutting down.

      • shutdownHook

        protected final java.lang.Thread shutdownHook
        The shutdown hook used by this ShardManager. If this is null the shutdown hook is disabled.

      • token

        protected final java.lang.String token
        The token of the account associated with this ShardManager.

      • worker

        protected java.util.concurrent.Future<?> worker
        The worker running on the ScheduledExecutorService that spawns new shards.

      • gatewayURL

        protected java.lang.String gatewayURL
        The gateway url for JDA to use. Will be nul until the first shard is created.

      • gameProvider

        protected java.util.function.IntFunction<Game> gameProvider
        The gameProvider new JDA instances should have on startup.

      • idleProvider

        protected java.util.function.IntFunction<java.lang.Boolean> idleProvider
        Whether or not new JDA instances should be marked as afk on startup.

      • statusProvider

        protected java.util.function.IntFunction<OnlineStatus> statusProvider
        The statusProvider new JDA instances should have on startup.

      • contextProvider

        protected java.util.function.IntFunction<java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> contextProvider
        The MDC context provider new JDA instances should use on startup.

      • enableMDC

        protected boolean enableMDC
        Whether to use the MDC context provider.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultShardManager

        protected DefaultShardManager(int shardsTotal,
                              java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> shardIds,
                              SessionController controller,
                              java.util.List<java.lang.Object> listeners,
                              java.lang.String token,
                              IEventManager eventManager,
                              java.util.function.IntFunction<Game> gameProvider,
                              java.util.function.IntFunction<OnlineStatus> statusProvider,
                              okhttp3.OkHttpClient.Builder httpClientBuilder,
                              com.neovisionaries.ws.client.WebSocketFactory wsFactory,
                              java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory threadFactory,
                              int maxReconnectDelay,
                              int corePoolSize,
                              boolean enableVoice,
                              boolean enableShutdownHook,
                              boolean enableBulkDeleteSplitting,
                              boolean autoReconnect,
                              java.util.function.IntFunction<java.lang.Boolean> idleProvider,
                              boolean retryOnTimeout,
                              boolean useShutdownNow,
                              boolean enableMDC,
                              java.util.function.IntFunction<java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> contextProvider)
        Creates a new DefaultShardManager instance.
        Parameters:
        shardsTotal - The total amount of shards or -1 to retrieve the recommended amount from discord.
        shardIds - A Collection of all shard ids that should be started in the beginning or null to start all possible shards. This will be ignored if shardsTotal is -1.
        controller - The SessionController
        listeners - The event listeners for new JDA instances.
        token - The token
        eventManager - The event manager
        audioSendFactory - The IAudioSendFactory
        gameProvider - The games used at startup of new JDA instances
        statusProvider - The statusProvider used at startup of new JDA instances
        httpClientBuilder - The OkHttpClient.Builder
        wsFactory - The WebSocketFactory
        threadFactory - The ThreadFactory
        maxReconnectDelay - The max reconnect delay
        corePoolSize - The core pool size for JDA's internal executor
        enableVoice - Whether or not Voice should be enabled
        enableShutdownHook - Whether or not the shutdown hook should be enabled
        enableBulkDeleteSplitting - Whether or not bulk delete splitting should be enabled
        autoReconnect - Whether or not auto reconnect should be enabled
        idleProvider - The Function that is used to set a shards idle state
        retryOnTimeout - hether the Requester should retry when a SocketTimeoutException occurs.
        useShutdownNow - Whether the ShardManager should use JDA#shutdown() or not
        enableMDC - Whether MDC should be enabled
        contextProvider - The MDC context provider new JDA instances should use on startup

      • addEventListener

        public void addEventListener(java.lang.Object... listeners)
        Description copied from interface: ShardManager
        Adds all provided listeners to the event-listeners that will be used to handle events.

        Note: when using the InterfacedEventListener (default), given listener must be instance of EventListener!

        Specified by:
        addEventListener in interface ShardManager
        Parameters:
        listeners - The listener(s) which will react to events.

      • restart

        public void restart(int shardId)
        Description copied from interface: ShardManager
        Restarts the shards with the given id only.
        If there is no shard with the given Id this method acts like ShardManager.start(int).
        Specified by:
        restart in interface ShardManager
        Parameters:
        shardId - The id of the target shard

      • restart

        public void restart()
        Description copied from interface: ShardManager
        Restarts all shards, shutting old ones down first.

        As all shards need to connect to discord again this will take equally long as the startup of a new ShardManager (using the 5000ms + backoff as delay between starting new JDA instances).

        Specified by:
        restart in interface ShardManager

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: ShardManager
        Shuts down all JDA shards, closing all their connections. After this method has been called the ShardManager instance can not be used anymore.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface ShardManager

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown(int shardId)
        Description copied from interface: ShardManager
        Shuts down the shard with the given id only.
        This does nothing if there is no shard with the given id.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface ShardManager
        Parameters:
        shardId - The id of the shard that should be stopped

      • start

        public void start(int shardId)
        Description copied from interface: ShardManager
        Adds a new shard with the given id to this ShardManager and starts it.
        Specified by:
        start in interface ShardManager
        Parameters:
        shardId - The id of the shard that should be started

        protected JDAImpl buildInstance(int shardId)

      • setGameProvider

        public void setGameProvider(java.util.function.IntFunction<Game> gameProvider)
        Description copied from interface: ShardManager
        Sets provider that provider the Game for all shards.
        A Game can be retrieved via Game.playing(String). For streams you provide a valid streaming url as second parameter.

        This will also change the provider for shards that are created in the future.

        Specified by:
        setGameProvider in interface ShardManager
        Parameters:
        gameProvider - A Game instance or null to reset
        See Also:
        Game.playing(String), Game.streaming(String, String)

      • setIdleProvider

        public void setIdleProvider(java.util.function.IntFunction<java.lang.Boolean> idleProvider)
        Description copied from interface: ShardManager
        Sets the provider that decides for all shards whether they should be marked as afk or not.

        This will also change the provider for shards that are created in the future.

        Specified by:
        setIdleProvider in interface ShardManager
        Parameters:
        idleProvider - boolean

      • setStatusProvider

        public void setStatusProvider(java.util.function.IntFunction<OnlineStatus> statusProvider)
        Description copied from interface: ShardManager
        Sets the provider that provides the OnlineStatus for all shards.

        This will also change the provider for shards that are created in the future.

        Specified by:
        setStatusProvider in interface ShardManager
        Parameters:
        statusProvider - the OnlineStatus to be used (OFFLINE/null -> INVISIBLE)

      • createExecutor

        protected java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService createExecutor(java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory threadFactory)
        This method creates the internal ScheduledExecutorService. It is intended as a hook for custom implementations to create their own executor.
        Returns:
        A new ScheduledExecutorService
